instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to estimate the concentration of the heavy metal nickel (Ni) in agricultural soil?
Output: Hyperspectral image was used in the related study.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to estimate the concentration of the heavy metal nickel (Ni) in agricultural soil?
Output: DWT (discrete wavelet transform) spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to estimate the concentration of the heavy metal nickel (Ni) in agricultural soil.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the retrieval models in the related study to estimate the concentration of the heavy metal nickel (Ni) in agricultural soil and how far can this metric go?
Output:

As for how far this metric can go, the text does not provide information on the limitations or extent of the metric. It only states that the retrieval framework can produce more robust and accurate predictions compared to those relying solely on correlation coefficients.

instruction: What machine learning algorithms were used in the retrieval method to estimate the concentration of nickel in agricultural soil using spaceborne hyperspectral imagery?
Output: The retrieval method used five machine learning algorithms in estimating the concentration of nickel in agricultural soil using spaceborne hyperspectral imagery. These algorithms include tree-based ensemble learning, neural network-based, and kernel-based models.

instruction: Can the DWT combined with t-distributed stochastic neighbor embedding (tSNE) coupled extreme gradient boosting (XGboost) retrieval model be used to estimate the concentration of other heavy metals in agricultural soil using spaceborne hyperspectral imagery?
Output: Based on the information provided in the text, it is not explicitly stated whether the DWT combined with t-distributed stochastic neighbor embedding (tSNE) coupled extreme gradient boosting (XGboost) retrieval model can be used to estimate the concentration of other heavy metals in agricultural soil using spaceborne hyperspectral imagery. The study specifically focuses on the estimation of nickel (Ni) concentration in agricultural soil. Therefore, it is unclear whether the same retrieval model can be applied to estimate the concentration of other heavy metals. Further research or information would be needed to determine the applicability of the retrieval model to other heavy metals.
